wikipedia_page.main: Major-General Henry Rodolph Davies,  (21 September 1865 – 4 January 1950) was a British Army officer, who commanded the 11th (Northern) Division during the First World War.

response: Davies was born in London, the son of Lt.-Gen. Henry Fanshawe Davies and his wife, Ellen Christine Alexandra Hankey. His grandfather was General Francis John Davies (died 1878) and his great-grandfather was Admiral of the Fleet Sir Thomas Byam Martin. The family seat was Elmley Castle, Pershore, Worcestershire. His younger brother was Maj-Gen. Henry Rodolph Davies (1865–1950). He was educated at Eton College.
*Henry Rodolph Davies (1865–1950), British Army major general
